gff2fasta.py - output sequences from genomic features¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Genomics Intervals Sequences GFF Fasta Transformation

Purpose¶

This script outputs the genomic sequences for intervals within a gff formatted file.

The ouput can be optionall masked and filtered.

Usage¶

Example:

python gff2fasta.py --genome-file=hg19 < features.gff > features.fasta

Type:

python gff2fasta.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: gff2fasta.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  --is-gtf              input is gtf instead of gff.
  -g GENOME_FILE, --genome-file=GENOME_FILE
                        filename with genome [default=none].
  -m, --merge           merge adjacent intervals with the same attributes.
                        [default=False]
  -e FEATURE, --feature=FEATURE
                        filter by a feature, for example 'exon', 'CDS'. If set
                        to the empty string, all entries are output [none].
  -f gff, --filename-masks=gff
                        mask sequences with regions given in gff file [none].
  --remove-masked-regions
                        remove regions instead of masking [False].
  --min-length=MIN_LENGTH
                        set minimum length for sequences output [0]
  --max-length=MAX_LENGTH
                        set maximum length for sequences output [0]
  --extend-at=EXTEND_AT
                        extend at no end, 3', 5' or both ends. If 3only or
                        5only are set, only the added sequence is returned
                        [default=none]
  --extend-by=EXTEND_BY
                        extend by # bases [default=100]
  --masker=MASKER       apply masker [none].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
